definitions.text: the act of fixing firmly in place
examples: he ordered the planting of policemen outside every doorway

definitions.text: a collection of plants (trees or shrubs or flowers) in a particular area
examples: the landscape architect suggested a small planting in the northwest corner

definitions.text: putting seeds or young plants in the ground to grow
examples: the planting of corn is hard work

definitions.text: put or set (seeds, seedlings, or plants) into the ground
examples: Let's plant flowers in the garden

definitions.text: fix or set securely or deeply
examples: He planted a knee in the back of his opponent
The dentist implanted a tooth in the gum

definitions.text: set up or lay the groundwork for
place something or someone in a certain position in order to secretly observe or deceive
examples: plant bugs in the dissident's apartment
Plant a thought in the students' minds
